tuv.seg: Appealing your driving test results
Achomharc a dhéanamh maidir le torthaí do thástála tiomána
If you are unhappy with the results of your driving test in Ireland, it is possible to appeal these results
Mura bhfuil tú sásta le torthaí do thástála tiomána in Éirinn, is féidir leat achomharc a dhéanamh ar na torthaí seo
The driving test appeals procedure is a statutory one
Is nós imeachta reachtúil atá san achomharc ar thástáil tiomána
That is, your right to appeal your driving test results are set down in Irish law
Is é sin, tá do chearta chun achomharc a dhéanamh ar thorthaí do thástála tiomána leagtha síos i ndlí na hÉireann
The legislation that deals with your right to appeal is set down in Section 33(5) of the Road Traffic Act 1961
Tá an reachtaíocht a dhéileálann le do cheart chun achomhairc leagtha síos in Alt 33 (5) den Acht um Thrácht ar Bhóithre 1961
Appeals against driving test results are heard in the District Court by a judge sitting alone
Éisteann breitheamh amháin atá ag suí leis/léi féin le hachomhairc i gcoinne torthaí tástála tiomána sa Chúirt Dúiche
That is, there is no jury involved
Is é sin le rá, ní bhíonn aon ghiúiré ann
In order to begin appeal proceedings, you must lodge your appeal with your local District Court Office
Ní mór duit d’achomharc a lóisteáil le d’oifig Cúirte Dúiche áitiúil chun tús a chur le himeachtaí achomhairc
This can be done either by visiting the office in person or you may instruct a solicitor to do so on your behalf
Is féidir leat é seo a dhéanamh trí chuairt a thabhairt ar an oifig tú féin nó is féidir leat treoir a thabhairt do aturnae é sin a dhéanamh ar do shon
You are not obliged to have a solicitor represent you and you may choose to represent yourself if you so wish
Ní gá duit aturnae a bheith agat chun ionadaíocht a dhéanamh ort agus is féidir leat a bheith i láthair ar do shon féin más mian leat
It is a very straightforward process and you will receive assistance in the court from the judge
Ní próiseas casta é agus gheobhaidh tú cabhair ón mbreitheamh sa chúirt
Starting off the driving test appeal process
Tús a chur leis an bpróiseas achomhairc maidir le do thástáil tiomána
To start off the appeals procedure, you must contact your local District Court Office and supply them with a written outline of the reasons why you feel the result of the driving test was unfair

Chun tús a chur leis an nós imeachta achomhairc, ní mór duit dul i dteagmháil le d’Oifig Cúirte Dúiche áitiúil agus cuntas a thabhairt i scríbhinn ar na cúiseanna go gceapann tú go raibh toradh na tástála míchothrom
This does not need to be in the form of an affidavit but must set out the reasons you will be relying on in during the court hearing
Ní gá dó seo a bheith ina mhionnscríbhinn ach ní mór dó na cúiseanna a mbeidh tú ag brath orthu le linn na héisteachta cúirte a bheith leagtha síos ann
Once the District Court Office receive your request they will prepare a notice of appeal on your behalf which will be issued to the driving tester and to the Road Safety Authority
Nuair a fhaigheann Oifig na Cúirte Dúiche d’iarratas réiteoidh siad fógra achomhairc ar do shon, a eiseofar ar an scrúdaitheoir tiomána agus ar an tÚdarás um Shábháilteacht ar Bhóithre

This will put both parties (that is, you and the Authority) on notice of your intention to appeal the test result and will give them an opportunity to contest the matter when it comes before the District Court

Tabharfaidh sé seo fógra don dá pháirtí (is é sin le rá, tusa agus an tÚdarás) go bhfuil sé i gceist agat achomharc a dhéanamh ar thoradh na tástála agus tabharfaidh sé an deis dóibh conspóid a dhéanamh ar an ábhar nuair a thagann sé os comhair na Cúirte Dúiche
A useful reference to give to the District Court Office if you wish to appeal your test result is Form No
Tagairt úsáideach le tabhairt d’Oifig na Cúirte Dúiche más mian leat achomharc a dhéanamh ar thoradh do thástála ná Foirm Uimh
97.2 Schedule C, Order 97, rule 3(1)
97.2 Sceideal C, Ordú 97, riail 3(1)
This reference will indicate the correct form to be used by the Court Office in your appeal
Léireoidh an tagairt seo an fhoirm chuí a bheidh le húsáid ag Oifig na Cúirte i d’achomharc
This notice of appeal requires either your signature or that of your solicitor, if you engage one
Ní mór do shíniú féin, nó síniú d’aturnae má tá aturnae ag obair duit, a bheith ar an bhfógra achomhairc seo
A small stamp duty charge is payable by you to the District Court Office for the issue of a Notice of Appeal
Tá táille dleacht stampála 18 euro iníoctha agat d’Oifig na Cúirte Dúiche chun Fógra Achomhairc a eisiúint
The District Court Office will notify you of the time, date and place for the hearing of your appeal
Cuirfidh Oifig na Cúirte Dúiche ar an eolas tú maidir le ham, dáta agus láthair éisteachta d’achomhairc
The timeframe for when your case is heard will depend on your District Court
Beidh fráma ama na héisteachta ag brath ar do Chúirt Dúiche
On the day of the hearing you appear in court and wait until your case is called
Ar lá na héisteachta tiocfaidh tú chuig an gcúirt agus fanfaidh tú go dtí go nglaoitear do chás
Your case will be heard before a judge but with no jury present
Éistfear do chás os comhair breithimh ach ní bheidh aon giúiré i láthair
The case is heard in open court
Éistear an cás i gcúirt oscailte
That is, in public
Is é sin le rá, go poiblí
When your case is called you will be required to go into the witness stand and give evidence on oath as to why you want the result of your driving test to be set aside by the judge

Nuair a ghlaoitear do chás, beidh ort dul isteach i seastán na bhfinnéithe agus fianaise a thabhairt faoi mhionn maidir leis an gcúis gur mian leat go gcuirfeadh an breitheamh toradh do thástála tiomána ar leataobh
After you have completed your evidence you may be cross-examined (asked questions) by the driving tester or their legal representative and you may also be asked questions by the judge

Tar éis duit do chuid fianaise a chríochnú is féidir leis an scrúdaitheoir tiomána nó a n-ionadaí dlí croscheistiú a dhéanamh ort (ceisteanna a chur ort) agus is féidir leis an mbreitheamh ceisteanna a chur ort freisin

If the driving tester is in court they will then be given an opportunity to give evidence to the court (in other words, their version of events) and you will be entitled to question them once they has completed their evidence

Má tá an scrúdaitheoir tiomána sa chúirt, tabharfar an deis dó/di fianaise a thabhairt don chúirt (i bhfocail eile, a leagan féin den scéal a insint) agus beidh tusa i dteideal ceisteanna a chur orthu nuair a chríochnaíonn siad a gcuid fianaise
In a driving test appeal the District Court is the court of final instance
In achomharc ar thástáil tiomána, is í an Chúirt Dúiche an chúirt chéime deiridh
This means whatever decision is made by the judge cannot be appealed and it is final
Ciallaíonn sé seo nach féidir achomharc a dhéanamh ar chinneadh an bhreithimh agus go bhfuil sé críochnaitheach
Financial compensation is not available for driving test appeal cases
Níl cúiteamh airgeadais ar fáil i gcásanna achomhairc ar thástáil tiomána
A District Court judges can only make one of two decisions in a driving test appeal case:
Ní féidir le breithiúna Cúirte Dúiche ach ceann amháin de dhá chinneadh a dhéanamh i gcás achomhairc ar thástáil tiomána
• Your appeal is refused: the judge agrees with the decision of the driving tester that you failed your test
• Diúltaítear do d’achomharc: aontaíonn an breitheamh le cinneadh an scrúdaitheora tiomána gur theip ort i do thástáil
• Your appeal is upheld: the judge is satisfied that your driving test was not conducted properly
• Tacaítear le d’achomharc: tá an breitheamh sásta nach ndearnadh do thástáil tiomána i gceart
You will then be offered a further driving test free of charge
Déanfar tástáil tiomána eile a thairiscint duit saor in aisce
If the judge directs another test to be carried out, the Department of Transport, Tourism and Sport must arrange to have it conducted by another tester
Má threoraíonn an breitheamh go bhfuil tástáil eile le déanamh, ní mór don Roinn Iompair, Turasóireachta agus Spóirt a shocrú go ndéanfaidh scrúdaitheoir eile é
It is worth noting, the court cannot enquire into the findings of the tester
Is fiú a thabhairt faoi deara nach féidir leis an gcúirt fiosrú a dhéanamh maidir le torthaí an scrúdaitheora
It can only decide whether they conducted the test with malice, oppression or unfair conduct
Ní féidir léi ach cinneadh a dhéanamh an ndearnadh an tástáil le mailís, cos ar bolg nó iompar míchothrom
This means that if the court is satisfied with the way in which the test took place it will not order a new test
Ciallaíonn sé seo nach n-ordóidh an chúirt tástáil nua má tá sí sásta leis an gcaoi a rinneadh an tástáil
Previous cases on these matters have been heard before the courts
Éisteadh cásanna ar na hábhair seo sna cúirteanna cheana féin
Those cases were Geraghty v Morris 2 AU E.R
Ba iad seo Geraghty v Morris 2 AU E.R
269 and Carrigan v Fox (1966) S.L.T.79
269 agus Carrigan v Fox (1966) S.L.T.79
No financial compensation is available in driving test appeal cases
Níl aon chúiteamh airgeadais ar fáil i gcásanna achomhairc ar thástáil tiomána
In other words you will not receive any compensation for any costs associated with either failing your test or in taking the appeal
I bhfocail eile, ní bhfaighidh tú aon chúiteamh as costais a bhaineann le teipeadh i do thástáil ná an t-achomharc a dhéanamh
There is a small stamp duty payable to the District Court Office on the application for a Notice of Appeal to the District Court
Tá dleacht stampála beag iníoctha le hOifig na Cúirte Dúiche ar an iarratas ar Fhógra Achomhairc chuig an gCúirt Dúiche
If your solicitor represents you in court, bear in mind that solicitors in Ireland are required to fully inform you in writing of all professional fees in advance
Má dhéanann d’aturnae ionadaíocht ort sa chúirt, cuimhnigh go bhfuil dualgas ar aturnaetha in Éirinn tú a chur ar an eolas maidir le gach táille ghairmiúil roimh ré
If it is not possible to give you a definite sum, they must estimate a sum (or at the very least describe the basis upon which charges or fees will be calculated)
Murar féidir suim dearfach a thabhairt duit, ní mór dóibh suim a mheas (nó ar a laghad cur síos a dhéanamh ar an mbunús ar a ndéanfar muirir nó táillí a ríomh)
Usually solicitors will wait until a case is conducted before requiring payment of their fees
Is iondúil go bhfanfaidh aturnaetha go dtí go bhfuil cás thart sula ndéanfaidh siad íocaíocht a lorg ar a dtáillí
Sometimes fees will be requested in advance, especially in a case where you run a high risk of losing
Iarrtar táillí roimh ré scaití, go háirithe i gcás ina bhfuil an-bhaol go gcaillfidh tú
Solicitors in Ireland charge competitive rates, so shop around and obtain some quotes before you decide on a legal representative
Bíonn rátaí iomaíocha á ngearradh ag aturnaetha in Éirinn, mar sin déan do chuid taighde agus faigh cúpla meastachán sula roghnaíonn tú ionadaí dlí
